definition: commerce/merchant/dealer/to consult/2nd note in pentatonic scale/quotient (as in 智商[zhi4 shang1], intelligence quotient)

sentences.english: Goodwill is booked as an intangible asset.
sentences.chinese: 商譽作爲一項無形資產入賬。

sentences.english: Mobile phone accessories in the industry, establishing a good reputation.
sentences.chinese: 在手機配件行業樹立了良好的商譽。

sentences.english: Unidentifiable intangible assets refer to the commercial credit standing.
sentences.chinese: 不可辨認無形資產是指商譽。

sentences.english: The aggregate carrying value of the business reputation apportioned to the above-mentioned asset groups;
sentences.chinese: 分攤到上述資產組的商譽的賬面價值合計。

sentences.english: Whatever it is out-purchased or self-created, the value of goodwill always comes from the inner of enterprises.
sentences.chinese: 無論是外購還是自創，商譽的價值都產生於企業內部。

sentences.english: That kind of responsiveness will get you a level of goodwill money won´t buy.
sentences.chinese: 有求必應將爲你實現商譽投資也無法實現的價值。

sentences.english: You can live a full and rewarding life without ever thinking about Goodwill and its amortization.
sentences.chinese: 你根本不用想商譽和其攤銷，也能生活得很充實有益。

sentences.english: The amortization of self-produced goodwill should be reevaluated year after year.
sentences.chinese: 對自創商譽的攤銷可採用逐年重估法。

sentences.english: We advocate commercial reputation and morality as to fulfill the desire FOR unashamed pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 本店崇尚商譽商德，以期得到問心無愧的滿足。

sentences.english: Goodwill is the difference between the price paid for an asset and its fair market value.
sentences.chinese: 商譽是所付資產價格和市場價值的差值。

sentences.english: American firms used to be allowed to amortise goodwill over many years.
sentences.chinese: 過去美國的企業被允許將商譽在很多年內逐步攤銷。

sentences.english: The goodwill generated due to merger may be amortized within 5 years;
sentences.chinese: 四因合併產生之商譽得於五年內攤銷之。

sentences.english: But if all that goodwill stuff fails, Huawei will resort to persistence.
sentences.chinese: 但是如果華爲的商譽失敗了，華爲將會離開。

definition: to keep a promise/to honor an agreement
